availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jackson M. Terrill (Green County, Kentucky, resident.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of David Terrill and Lucy M. Terrill. Resident of Adair County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Green County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 72B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 693.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Upper Brush Creek Precinct, p. 510A.
"John Morton 'Jackson' Terrill (1841-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial 61939554, accessed March 27, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61939554.
